intro: Hieracium pervirens, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its flowering stems are usually unbranched and bear several flower heads. Hieracium pervirens is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a common weed in some regions.
